eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SmoothCamera
eventsFunctionsExtensions.previewIconUrl: https://resources.gdevelop-app.com/assets/Icons/Line Hero Pack/Master/SVG/Computers and Hardware/Computers and Hardware_camcoder_gopro_go_pro_camera.svg
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
description: The camera follows an object according to:
- a frame rate independent catch-up speed to make the scrolling from smooth to strong
- a maximum speed to do linear following ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://platformer-with-tilemap)) or slow down the camera when teleporting the object
- a follow-free zone to avoid scrolling on small movements
- an offset to see further in one direction
- an extra delay and catch-up speed to give an impression of speed (useful for dash)
- position forecasting and delay to simulate a cameraman response time
A platformer dedicated behavior allows to switch of settings when the character is in air or on the floor. This can be used to stabilize the camera when jumping.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Smoothly scroll to follow an object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: SmoothCamera

events.comment: Update private properties through setters to check their values and initialize state.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object. This action must be called after the object has moved for the frame.

events.comment: The camera following is called with an action, the call from doStepPreEvents must be disabled to avoid to do it twice.

eventsFunctions.description: Move the camera closer to the object.
eventsFunctions.name: DoMoveCameraCloser

events.comment:
Delaying and forecasting can be used at the same time.
Forecasting only use the positions that are older than the one used for delaying.
The behavior uses a position history that is split in 2 arrays:
- one for delaying the position (from TimeFromStart to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay)
- one for forecasting the position (from TimeFromStart - CamearDelay to TimeFromStart - CamearDelay - ForecastHistoryDuration

At each frame, the camera must catchup the target by a given ratio (speed)
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1) - targetX) * speed

The frame rate must not impact on the catch-up speed, we don't want a speed in ratio per frame but a speed ratio per second, like this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - 1s) - targetX) * speed

Ok, but we still need to process each frame, we can use a exponent for this:
cameraX(t) - targetX = (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * speed^timeDelta
cameraX(t) = targetX + (cameraX(t - timeDelta) - targetX) * exp(timeDelta * ln(speed))

pow is probably more efficient than precalculated log if the speed is changed continuously but this might be rare enough.

Use the object center when no delay is asked.
Remove history entries that are too old to be useful for delaying and pass it to the history for forecasting.
Don't move the camera if there is not enough history.

Add the extra delay that could be needed to respect the speed limit in waiting mode.

speedRatio = min(speedMaxX / historySpeedX, speedMaxY / historySpeedY)
delay += min(0, timeDelta * (1 - speedRatio))
The time with delay is now between the first 2 indexes

eventsFunctions.description: Update forecasted position. This is called in doStepPreEvents.
eventsFunctions.name: UpdateForecastedPosition

events.comment:
Simple linear regression
y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX

Note than we could use only one position every N positions to reduce the process time,
but if we really need efficient process JavaScript and circular queues are a must.

VarianceX = sum((X[i] - MeanX)²)
VarianceY = sum((Y[i] - MeanY)²)
Covariance = sum((X[i] - MeanX) * (Y[i] - MeanY))

y = A * x + B

A = Covariance / VarianceX
B = MeanY - A * MeanX
Axis permutation to avoid a ratio between 2 numbers near 0.
Permute back axis

eventsFunctions.description: Project history ends position to have the vector on the line from linear regression. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.
eventsFunctions.name: ProjectHistoryEnds
eventsFunctions.sentence: Project history oldest: _PARAM2_;_PARAM3_ and newest position: _PARAM4_;_PARAM5_ of _PARAM0_

events.comment:
Perpendicular line:
pA = -1/a; 
pB = -pA * x + y

Intersection:
/ ProjectedY = a * ProjectedX + b
\ ProjectedY = pA * ProjectedX + b

Solution that is cleaned out from indeterminism (like 0 / 0 or infinity / infinity):
ProjectedX= (x + (y - b) * a) / (a² + 1)
ProjectedY = y + (x * a - y + b) / (a² + 1)

eventsFunctions.description: Return the ratio between forecast time and the duration of the history. This function is only called by UpdateForecastedPosition.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Recolorizer
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Independently change the colors of a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
description: This extension allows to restyle a sprite, a tiled sprite or a panel sprite.
It can be used to:
- Change the color of player short according to its team color.
- Add small color variation to trees of a forest.
- Restyle objects to match other assets.
An example shows how to change the 2 main colors of an object ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://recolorizer)).
This extension is experimental and might no longer work in future version of GDevelop.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

inlineCode: * Converts an HSL color value to RGB. Conversion formula
* Assumes h, s, and l are contained in the set [0, 1] and
* returns r, g, and b in the set [0, 255].
var hue2rgb = function hue2rgb(p, q, t) {
var q = l < 0.5 ? l * (1 + s) : l + s - l * s;
* Converts an RGB color value to HSL. Conversion formula
* Assumes r, g, and b are contained in the set [0, 255] and
* returns h, s, and l in the set [0, 1].
var max = Math.max(r, g, b), min = Math.min(r, g, b);
s = l > 0.5 ? d / (2 - max - min) : d / (max + min);
case r: h = (g - b) / d + (g < b ? 6 : 0); break;
case g: h = (b - r) / d + 2; break;
case b: h = (r - g) / d + 4; break;
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {{x: number, y: number, width: number, height: number}} frame
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
const recolorizeTexture = function (sourceCanvas, targetCanvas, frame, originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
// hue is not knowned for graycase colors.
// graycase pixels must take the targeted hue
pixelHsl[0] = pixelSaturation === 0 ? targetHue : gdjs.evtTools.common.mod(pixelHue - originHue + targetHue, 1);
// white pixels must also take the targeted saturation.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
const getRecolorizationKey = function (originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
* Manage recolorizations to ensure uniqueness of textures.
* Register a recolorization usage and get recolored textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
recolorizedSprite = { userCount: 0, textures: targetTextures, canvas: targetCanvas };
* Apply a recoloration to every textures.
* @param {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} recolorizations
/** @type {Array<{originColor: [number, number, number], targetColor: [number, number, number], hueScope: number, saturationScope: number, lighnessScope: number}>} */
* Replace a color with an other one.
* @param {[number, number, number]} originColor The color to replace from.
* @param {[number, number, number]} targetColor The color to replate to.
* @param {number} hueScope Pixels within the hue scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} saturationScope Pixels within the saturation scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
* @param {number} lighnessScope Pixels within the lightness scope relatively from originColor are recolorized.
Recolorizer.prototype.recolorizeSprite = function (originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope) {
this.recolorizationKey += getRecolorizationKey(originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope);
this.recolorizations.push({ originColor, targetColor, hueScope, saturationScope, lighnessScope});
* Reset the default textures of the object.
* Update the textures of the object.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Westboy31
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: FlashTransitionPainter
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Behavior for shape painter allows you to paint a color all over the screen for period of time with an effect (useful for simulate flash and transition effect).
description: * __Paint effect:__ Action to paint a color all over the screen for a period of time with specific effect.
effect type:
* __Flash:__ is a monochrome color appear with fade then disappear with fade out.
* __Vertical:__ is a monochrome color comes from right side then comes back.
* __Horizontal:__ is a monochrome color come from top side then comes back.
* __Circular:__ is a circle which increases from the center and narrows.
* __Paint effect ended:__ event when the paint effect ends.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Paint all over the screen a color for a period of time.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: FlashTransitionPainter

events.comment: Disable effect when the game starts.
Avoid default parameter of painter that could make the extension doesn't work.

Initialise position of painter. 
Increment or decrement "_TimeProgressionEffect" depending on direction.

Here this the paints functions of different effect depending on the type chosen by the user.
Detect the direction of the animation and its end.
Type 1 : flash effect.
Type 2 : screen come from top then return.
Type 3 : screen come from left then return.
Type 4 : a circle scale up from the middle then scale down.
The repeat 5 times is used to have clean and smooth edges , especially for circle.
Reset variables.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Manage health points and damage, including a protective shield and armor.
description: Manage health points including a protective shield and armor. Health can be assigned to players, enemies, NPCs, or even inanimate objects such as breaking doors and mining rocks.
Damage calculations are performed in this order:
Incoming Damage -> Is Damage Cooldown active? -> Chance to Dodge -> Flat Damage Reduction -> Percent Damage Reduction -> Damage to Shield -> Damage to Health
How to use:
- Set desired values in behavior properties
- To apply damage use “Apply damage to an object”
- To heal health, use “Heal object” action
- To activate the shield, use “Activate shield” action
- Health and shield regeneration will happen automatically based on properties
Tips:
- While damage cooldown is active, no damage will be applied to health or shield (the object is invincible)
- Try using the “Blink” extension while damage cooldown is active
- Use the “Is just damaged” or "Is just healed" conditions to trigger sound and visual effects
Health properties:
- Starting health points
- Maximum health points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Damage cooldown (seconds) Use "0" for no cooldown
- Rate of health regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before health regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Allow heals to increase health above max health (regen will never exceed max health)
Shield properties:
- Max shield points. Use "0" for no maximum
- Duration of shield (seconds) Use "0" to make shield permanent
- Rate of shield regeneration (points per second)
- Delay before shield regeneration starts after being hit (seconds)
- Block excess damage when shield is broken (yes/no)
The top-down RPG example uses this extension ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Manage health (life) points including a protective shield and armor.

Apply excess damage only if shield does not block excess damage

eventsFunctions.description: Enable (or disable) blocking excess damage when shield breaks.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Block excess damage when shield breaks
eventsFunctions.name: SetShieldBlockExcessDamage
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shield on _PARAM0_ blocks excess damage when it breaks: _PARAM2_

Don't check the timer when duration is zero (or negative)

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ButtonStates
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Use any object as a button and change appearance according to user interactions.
description: Use the "Button states" behavior to track user interactions with an object, including:
- Hovered
- Pressed
- Clicked
- Idle
Add additional behaviors to make juicy buttons with animated responses to user input:
- Size
- Color
- Animation
- Object effects

events.comment: The "Validated" state only last one frame.
Make sure the cursor position is only checked once per frame.
Touches are always pressed, so ShouldCheckHovering doesn't matter.

eventsFunctions.description: Reset the state of the button.
eventsFunctions.name: ResetState

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is not used.
eventsFunctions.name: IsIdle

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button was just clicked.
eventsFunctions.name: IsClicked

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the cursor is hovered over the button.
eventsFunctions.name: IsHovered

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is either hovered or pressed but not hovered.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFocused

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the button is currently being pressed outside with mouse or touch.
eventsFunctions.name: IsPressedOutside

eventsFunctions.description: the touch id that is using the button or 0 if none.
eventsFunctions.name: TouchId

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Enable effects on buttons based on their state.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ButtonObjectEffects

eventsFunctions.description: the idle state effect of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: IdleEffect

eventsFunctions.description: the focused state effect of the object. The state is Focused when the button is hovered or held outside.
eventsFunctions.name: FocusedEffect

eventsFunctions.description: the pressed state effect of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: PressedEffect

propertyDescriptors.label: Focused state effect

eventsFunctions.description: the pressed state animation name of the object.
eventsFunctions.name: PressedAnimationName

propertyDescriptors.label: Focused state animation name
propertyDescriptors.description: The state is Focused when the button is hovered or held outside.
propertyDescriptors.name: FocusedAnimationName

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: SpriteMultitouchJoystick
description: Multitouch joysticks can be used the same way as physical gamepads:
- 4 or 8 directions
- Analogus pads
- Player selection
- Controls mapping for top-down movement and platformer characters
There are ready-to-use joysticks in the asset-store [multitouch joysticks pack](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?initial-dialog=asset-store&asset-pack=multitouch-joysticks-multitouch-joysticks).

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a button is pressed on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: IsButtonPressed
eventsFunctions.sentence: Button _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pressed

eventsFunctions.description: Check if a button is released on a gamepad.
eventsFunctions.name: IsButtonReleased
eventsFunctions.sentence: Button _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is released

eventsFunctions.description: Change a button state for a multitouch controller.
eventsFunctions.name: SetButtonState
eventsFunctions.sentence: Mark _PARAM2_ button as _PARAM3_ for multitouch controller _PARAM1_

eventsFunctions.description: Change the dead zone radius of a joystick. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved).
eventsFunctions.name: SetDeadZone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the dead zone of multitouch joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the dead zone radius of a joystick. The deadzone is an area for which movement on sticks won't be taken into account (instead, the stick will be considered as not moved).
eventsFunctions.name: DeadZone
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change multitouch joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ dead zone to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: the direction index (left = 1, bottom = 1, right = 2, top = 3) for an angle (in degrees).
eventsFunctions.name: AngleTo4Way

eventsFunctions.description: the direction index (left = 1, bottom-left = 1... top-left = 7) for an angle (in degrees).
eventsFunctions.name: AngleTo8Way

eventsFunctions.description: Check if angle is in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: IsAngleIn4WayDirection

eventsFunctions.description: Check if angle is in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: IsAngleIn8WayDirection

eventsFunctions.description: Check if joystick is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: IsDirectionPushed4Way
eventsFunctions.sentence: Joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

events.comment: Make sure the joystick has moved from center

eventsFunctions.description: Check if joystick is pushed in a given direction.
eventsFunctions.name: IsDirectionPushed8Way
eventsFunctions.sentence: Joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ is pushed in direction _PARAM3_

events.comment: Make sure the joystick has moved from center

eventsFunctions.description: the percentage the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: JoystickForce

eventsFunctions.description: the force of multitouch contoller stick (from 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: StickForce

eventsFunctions.description: Change the percentage the thumb has been pulled away from the joystick center (Range: 0 to 1).
eventsFunctions.name: SetJoystickForce
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the force of the joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the angle the joystick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).

eventsFunctions.description: Return the angle the multitouch controller stick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: StickAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Change the angle the joystick is pointing towards (Range: -180 to 180).
eventsFunctions.name: SetJoystickAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the angle of the joystick _PARAM2_ of multitouch controller _PARAM1_ to _PARAM3_

eventsFunctions.description: Return the multitouch contoller stick force on X axis (from -1 at the left to 1 at the right).
eventsFunctions.name: StickForceX

eventsFunctions.description: Return the multitouch contoller stick force on Y axis (from -1 at the top to 1 at the bottom).
